article_title: House Votes For Lawmaker Oversight On IRS User Fees
article_text:
House Votes For Lawmaker Oversight On IRS User Fees

Law360, Washington (April 20, 2016, 4:52 PM ET) -- The U.S. House of Representatives on Wednesday passed legislation that would require the Internal Revenue Service to deposit user fees it collects into general federal revenue and bar it from hiring new employees until it certifies that no existing employees have "seriously delinquent" tax debts.



Both bills, H.R. 4885, the IRS Oversight While Eliminating Spending, or OWES, Act, and H.R. 1206, the No Hires for the Delinquent IRS Act, passed in mostly party-line votes, 245-179 and 254-170, respectively. The bills would restrict how the agency can...
